parameters.name: DBClusterDescription
parameters.description:
The description of the cluster.

*   The description cannot start with `http://` or `https://`.
*   The description must be 2 to 256 characters in length

parameters.name: DBClusterIds
parameters.description:
The cluster IDs.

> You can specify the ID of one cluster or IDs of more clusters within the preceding region.

parameters.name: DBClusterStatus
parameters.description:
The state of the cluster. Valid values:

*   **Preparing**: The cluster is being prepared.
*   **Creating**: The cluster is being created.
*   **Restoring**: The cluster is being restored from a backup.
*   **Running**: The cluster is running.
*   **Deleting**: The cluster is being deleted.
*   **ClassChanging**: The cluster specifications are being changed.
*   **NetAddressCreating**: A network connection is being created.
*   **NetAddressDeleting**: A network connection is being deleted.

parameters.name: DBVersion
parameters.description: The version of the cluster. Set the value to **3.0**.

parameters.name: PageNumber
parameters.description: The page number. Pages start from page 1. Default value: **1**.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description:
The number of entries per page. Valid values:

*   **30** (default)
*   **50**
*   **100**

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description:
The region ID of the clusters.

> You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~143074~~) operation to query the most recent region list.

parameters.name: ResourceGroupId
parameters.description: The ID of the resource group.

parameters.name: Tag
parameters.description: The tags that are added to the cluster.
